cards.name: Ugin, the Spirit Dragon
cards.text:
+2: Ugin, the Spirit Dragon deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
−X: Exile each permanent with converted mana cost X or less that's one or more colors.
−10: You gain 7 life, draw seven cards, then put up to seven permanent cards from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"To survive, you must seize every opportunity."
—Daghatar the Adamant
cards.name: Abzan Advantage
cards.text: Target player sacrifices an enchantment. Bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Abzan Runemark
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
Enchanted creature has vigilance as long as you control a black or green permanent.

cards.flavor: "A tempest is coming. Turn your faces toward the wind!"
cards.name: Abzan Skycaptain
cards.text:
Flying
When Abzan Skycaptain dies, bolster 2. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put two +1/+1 counters on it.)

cards.flavor: "We'll have time to put out the fires when those trapped within the ruins are safe."
cards.name: Arashin Cleric
cards.text: When Arashin Cleric enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

cards.flavor: "We do not hide from the dragons that pretend to rule the skies. If we did, the dragons would become our rulers, and our way of life would be lost."
cards.name: Aven Skirmisher
cards.text: Flying

cards.name: Channel Harm
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you and permanents you control this turn by sources you don't control. If damage is prevented this way, you may have Channel Harm deal that much damage to target creature.

cards.name: Citadel Siege
cards.text:
As Citadel Siege enters the battlefield, choose Khans or Dragons.
• Khans — At the beginning of combat on your turn, put two +1/+1 counters on target creature you control.
• Dragons — At the beginning of combat on each opponent's turn, tap target creature that player controls.

cards.flavor: "Our victories will protect a thousand generations."
cards.name: Daghatar the Adamant
cards.text:
Vigilance
Daghatar the Adamant enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
{1}{B/G}{B/G}: Move a +1/+1 counter from target creature onto a second target creature.

cards.flavor: He has spent years training his eyes and ears to detect the subtle signs of a dragon's approach.
cards.name: Dragon Bell Monk
cards.text:
Vigilance
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: "Dragons seek war. I bring it to them."
cards.name: Dragonscale General
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, bolster X, where X is the number of tapped creatures you control. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put X +1/+1 counters on it.)

cards.name: Elite Scaleguard
cards.text:
When Elite Scaleguard enters the battlefield, bolster 2. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put two +1/+1 counters on it.)
Whenever a creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it attacks, tap target creature defending player controls.

cards.flavor: Perfectly suited for life in the Shifting Wastes, the krushok is well protected by its horn, its hide, and its temper.
cards.name: Great-Horn Krushok

cards.flavor: It seldom rains in Abzan lands. When it does, the khan marks the occasion by honoring the families of the fallen.
cards.name: Honor's Reward
cards.text: You gain 4 life. Bolster 2. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put two +1/+1 counters on it.)

cards.name: Jeskai Barricade
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Defender
When Jeskai Barricade enters the battlefield, you may return another target creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Lightform
cards.text:
When Lightform enters the battlefield, it becomes an Aura with enchant creature. Manifest the top card of your library and attach Lightform to it. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
Enchanted creature has flying and lifelink.

cards.flavor: Every action has a foreseen purpose.
cards.name: Lotus-Eye Mystics
cards.text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
When Lotus-Eye Mystics enters the battlefield, return target enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: "Those who died in battle deserve their rest."
cards.name: Mardu Woe-Reaper
cards.text: Whenever Mardu Woe-Reaper or another Warrior enters the battlefield under your control, you may exile target creature card from a graveyard. If you do, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Mastery of the Unseen
cards.text:
Whenever a permanent you control is turned face up, you gain 1 life for each creature you control.
{3}{W}: Manifest the top card of your library. (Put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

cards.flavor: "Speak little. Do much."
cards.name: Monastery Mentor
cards.text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, put a 1/1 white Monk creature token with prowess onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: By studying dragon anatomy, Jeskai monks have learned how to locate clusters of nerves that will incapacitate even the mightiest dragons.
cards.name: Pressure Point
cards.text:
Tap target creature.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"The family is a tree, and in times of need, every branch can be a weapon."
—Daghatar the Adamant
cards.name: Rally the Ancestors
cards.text: Return each creature card with converted mana cost X or less from your graveyard to the battlefield. Exile those creatures at the beginning of your next upkeep. Exile Rally the Ancestors.

cards.name: Sage's Reverie
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Sage's Reverie enters the battlefield, draw a card for each Aura you control that's attached to a creature.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Aura you control that's attached to a creature.

cards.flavor: In the Shifting Wastes, more are killed by sand than by steel.
cards.name: Sandblast
cards.text: Sandblast deals 5 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Sandsteppe Outcast
cards.text:
When Sandsteppe Outcast enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on Sandsteppe Outcast.
• Put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Ugin's magic reaches beyond the dragons. The clans have adapted it for war.
cards.name: Soul Summons
cards.text: Manifest the top card of your library. (Put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

cards.name: Soulfire Grand Master
cards.text:
Lifelink
Instant and sorcery spells you control have lifelink.
{2}{U/R}{U/R}: The next time you cast an instant or sorcery spell from your hand this turn, put that card into your hand instead of into your graveyard as it resolves.

cards.flavor:
"Every choice alters the path of fate."
—Sarkhan Vol
cards.name: Valorous Stance
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target creature gains indestructible until end of turn.
• Destroy target creature with toughness 4 or greater.

cards.flavor: "Learn from your enemies, but do not tolerate them."
cards.name: Wandering Champion
cards.text: Whenever Wandering Champion deals combat damage to a player, if you control a blue or red permanent, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.

cards.flavor: Dromoka's brood emerge from the dragon tempests covered with tough scales that protect them from most clan weapons and magic.
cards.name: Wardscale Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
As long as Wardscale Dragon is attacking, defending player can't cast spells.

cards.name: Aven Surveyor
cards.text:
Flying
When Aven Surveyor enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on Aven Surveyor.
• Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Cloudform
cards.text:
When Cloudform enters the battlefield, it becomes an Aura with enchant creature. Manifest the top card of your library and attach Cloudform to it. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
Enchanted creature has flying and hexproof.

cards.flavor:
"Study the topography of your enemies, and you will have a map to victory."
—Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest
cards.name: Enhanced Awareness
cards.text: Draw three cards, then discard a card.

cards.name: Fascination
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Each player draws X cards.
• Each player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"As the clans carved out their territories, we saw allies where the Mardu saw only obstacles."
—Yasova Dragonclaw
cards.name: Frost Walker
cards.text: When Frost Walker becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.

cards.name: Jeskai Infiltrator
cards.text:
Jeskai Infiltrator can't be blocked as long as you control no other creatures.
When Jeskai Infiltrator deals combat damage to a player, exile it and the top card of your library in a face-down pile, shuffle that pile, then manifest those cards. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

cards.name: Jeskai Runemark
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
Enchanted creature has flying as long as you control a red or white permanent.

cards.flavor: "The one who conquers the mind is greater than the one who conquers the world."
cards.name: Jeskai Sage
cards.text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
When Jeskai Sage dies, draw a card.

cards.flavor: "The lotus takes root where body and mind intersect. It blooms when body and mind become one."
cards.name: Lotus Path Djinn
cards.text:
Flying
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.flavor: The currents of the Marang wash away both tracks and blood.
cards.name: Marang River Prowler
cards.text:
Marang River Prowler can't block and can't be blocked.
You may cast Marang River Prowler from your graveyard as long as you control a black or green permanent.

cards.flavor:
"The bells may one day ring as an anthem of our own end."
—Kyu, Sage-Eye mystic
cards.name: Mindscour Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Mindscour Dragon deals combat damage to an opponent, target player puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.flavor: "The quieter the skies, the calmer the mind."
cards.name: Mistfire Adept
cards.text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, target creature gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Monastery Siege
cards.text:
As Monastery Siege enters the battlefield, choose Khans or Dragons.
• Khans — At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card, then discard a card.
• Dragons — Spells your opponents cast that target you or a permanent you control cost {2} more to cast.

cards.flavor: "To defeat your enemies, you must remove their ability to make war against you."
cards.name: Neutralizing Blast
cards.text: Counter target multicolored spell.

cards.flavor: "Every failure, every death only makes my strength greater."
cards.name: Rakshasa's Disdain
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} for each card in your graveyard.

cards.name: Reality Shift
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller manifests the top card of his or her library. (That player puts the top card of his or her library onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. If it's a creature card, it can be turned face up any time for its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: "Before you can open your third eye, you must prove you can open the first two."
cards.name: Refocus
cards.text:
Untap target creature.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Renowned Weaponsmith
cards.text:
{T}: Add {2} to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast artifact spells or activate abilities of artifacts.
{U}, {T}: Search your library for a card named Heart-Piercer Bow or Vial of Dragonfire, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Rite of Undoing
cards.text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Return target nonland permanent you control and target nonland permanent you don't control to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Sage-Eye Avengers
cards.text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever Sage-Eye Avengers attacks, you may return target creature to its owner's hand if its power is less than Sage-Eye Avengers's power.

cards.flavor:
"Show the enemy the true path, and the spirit will yearn to follow it."
—Houn, Jeskai elder
cards.name: Shifting Loyalties
cards.text: Exchange control of two target permanents that share a card type. (Artifact, creature, enchantment, land, and planeswalker are card types.)

cards.name: Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest
cards.text:
Prowess (Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, you may pay {R/W}{R/W}. If you do, target creature gains double strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor: A skullkeeper is the first to arrive after the palace archers strike down intruders, probing their brains for choice bits of knowledge.
cards.name: Sultai Skullkeeper
cards.text: When Sultai Skullkeeper enters the battlefield, put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"Ice can be shaped to any form, even the whisper of a memory."
—Mytha, Temur shaman
cards.name: Supplant Form
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. You put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of that creature.

cards.flavor: Few truly live in the moment.
cards.name: Temporal Trespass
cards.text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Take an extra turn after this one. Exile Temporal Trespass.

cards.name: Torrent Elemental
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Torrent Elemental attacks, tap all creatures defending player controls.
{3}{B/G}{B/G}: Put Torrent Elemental from exile onto the battlefield tapped. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.flavor: The maneuvers of the Abzan formation intrigued Ojutai in both their complexity and their futility.
cards.name: Whisk Away
cards.text: Put target attacking or blocking creature on top of its owner's library.

cards.flavor: The charm of a naga is undeniable.
cards.name: Will of the Naga
cards.text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Tap up to two target creatures. Those creatures don't untap during their controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Write into Being
cards.text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Manifest one of those cards, then put the other on the top or bottom of your library. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

cards.flavor: Boundaries drawn on maps or marked with stone have no meaning for the Mardu.
cards.name: Alesha's Vanguard
cards.text: Dash {2}{B} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

cards.flavor: The defenses of the Abzan extend well beyond the walls of their fortresses.
cards.name: Ancestral Vengeance
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Ancestral Vengeance enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1.

cards.flavor: "Why would I kill you all? Who then would be left to worship me?"
cards.name: Archfiend of Depravity
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each opponent's end step, that player chooses up to two creatures he or she controls, then sacrifices the rest.

cards.flavor: Every time he returns from battle unscathed, he feels a tinge of disappointment.
cards.name: Battle Brawler
cards.text: As long as you control a red or white permanent, Battle Brawler gets +1/+0 and has first strike.

cards.name: Brutal Hordechief
cards.text:
Whenever a creature you control attacks, defending player loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
{3}{R/W}{R/W}: Creatures your opponents control block this turn if able, and you choose how those creatures block.

cards.flavor: Ugin's whispered summons led Sarkhan Vol to the moment that would echo down the centuries and seal Tarkir's fate: the primal battle between Ugin and Nicol Bolas.
cards.name: Crux of Fate
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy all Dragon creatures.
• Destroy all non-Dragon creatures.

cards.flavor: The first khans of the Sultai relied on the magic of the rakshasa to ensure the survival of the clan.
cards.name: Dark Deal
cards.text: Each player discards all the cards in his or her hand, then draws that many cards minus one.

cards.flavor:
"Our emissaries are gifted negotiators."
—Alesha, Who Smiles at Death
cards.name: Diplomacy of the Wastes
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card. If you control a Warrior, that player loses 2 life.

cards.flavor: The Mardu warrior was overjoyed when Tasigur set him free and granted him passage through the jungle. He failed to notice the Sultai leader's cruel smile.
cards.name: Douse in Gloom
cards.text: Douse in Gloom deals 2 damage to target creature and you gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: On Tarkir, dragons emerge from enormous tempests, phenomena tied to Ugin's very presence on the plane.
cards.name: Fearsome Awakening
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. If it's a Dragon, put two +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.name: Ghastly Conscription
cards.text: Exile all creature cards from target player's graveyard in a face-down pile, shuffle that pile, then manifest those cards. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

cards.flavor: So long as death follows life, the supply lines of the Sultai will never be cut.
cards.name: Grave Strength
cards.text: Choose target creature. Put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard, then put a +1/+1 counter on that creature for each creature card in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: If everything in the Gurmag Swamp hungers for human flesh, what bait could be more effective?
cards.name: Gurmag Angler
cards.text: Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)

cards.name: Hooded Assassin
cards.text:
When Hooded Assassin enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on Hooded Assassin.
• Destroy target creature that was dealt damage this turn.

cards.name: Mardu Shadowspear
cards.text:
Whenever Mardu Shadowspear attacks, each opponent loses 1 life.
Dash {1}{B} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

cards.name: Mardu Strike Leader
cards.text:
Whenever Mardu Strike Leader attacks, put a 2/1 black Warrior creature token onto the battlefield.
Dash {3}{B} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

cards.flavor: He enjoys his work, for he sees only the worst Abzan criminals: those who betray their own kin.
cards.name: Merciless Executioner
cards.text: When Merciless Executioner enters the battlefield, each player sacrifices a creature.

cards.flavor: Dragons of Silumgar's brood begin to digest their prey even before consuming it, letting their caustic breath do much of the work.
cards.name: Noxious Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Noxious Dragon dies, you may destroy target creature with converted mana cost 3 or less.

cards.flavor: "Words have yet to halt an arrow."
cards.name: Orc Sureshot
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield under your control, target creature an opponent controls gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Palace Siege
cards.text:
As Palace Siege enters the battlefield, choose Khans or Dragons.
• Khans — At the beginning of your upkeep, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Dragons — At the beginning of your upkeep, each opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.

cards.flavor: "Hear me, nameless, and obey."
cards.name: Qarsi High Priest
cards.text: {1}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice another creature: Manifest the top card of your library. (Put that card onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

cards.flavor:
"Is it better to be a fool or a coward? Fools may get things done occasionally, but cowards live longer."
—Ghelesh Shadowmane, rakshasa mage
cards.name: Reach of Shadows
cards.text: Destroy target creature that's one or more colors.

cards.flavor:
"They were your friends, your family, your clan. They want only to welcome you."
—Tasigur, the Golden Fang
cards.name: Sibsig Host
cards.text: When Sibsig Host enters the battlefield, each player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Sibsig Muckdraggers
cards.text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
When Sibsig Muckdraggers enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Soulflayer
cards.text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
If a creature card with flying was exiled with Soulflayer's delve ability, Soulflayer has flying. The same is true for first strike, double strike, deathtouch, haste, hexproof, indestructible, lifelink, reach, trample, and vigilance.

cards.flavor: To the Sultai, Ugin's power was just one more resource to be exploited.
cards.name: Sultai Emissary
cards.text: When Sultai Emissary dies, manifest the top card of your library. (Put that card onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

cards.name: Sultai Runemark
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
Enchanted creature has deathtouch as long as you control a green or blue permanent. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Tasigur, the Golden Fang
cards.text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
{2}{G/U}{G/U}: Put the top two cards of your library into your graveyard, then return a nonland card of an opponent's choice from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: The cruelest tortures leave no mark upon the flesh.
cards.name: Tasigur's Cruelty
cards.text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Each opponent discards two cards.

cards.flavor: When Tasigur sent his ambassadors to the Abzan outpost, the true envoys were not the naga but the infectious rats they carried with them.
cards.name: Typhoid Rats
cards.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.flavor: "Greet death with sword in hand."
cards.name: Alesha, Who Smiles at Death
cards.text:
First strike
Whenever Alesha, Who Smiles at Death attacks, you may pay {W/B}{W/B}. If you do, return target creature card with power 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield tapped and attacking.

cards.flavor:
"If you must die today, make your death worthy of legend."
—Alesha, Who Smiles at Death
cards.name: Arcbond
cards.text: Choose target creature. Whenever that creature is dealt damage this turn, it deals that much damage to each other creature and each player.

cards.flavor: The scent of cooked flesh lingers in the charred landscape of Tarkir.
cards.name: Bathe in Dragonfire
cards.text: Bathe in Dragonfire deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.flavor: Bloodfire practitioners train to focus their rage, building it deep inside themselves until they are ready to release it as a devastating attack.
cards.name: Bloodfire Enforcers
cards.text: Bloodfire Enforcers has first strike and trample as long as an instant card and a sorcery card are in your graveyard.

cards.flavor:
"If the Mardu were more in tune with their beasts, they would not scare so easily."
—Jilaya, Temur whisperer
cards.name: Break Through the Line
cards.text: {R}: Target creature with power 2 or less gains haste until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.

cards.flavor: It is much easier to create fire than to contain it.
cards.name: Collateral Damage
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Collateral Damage, sacrifice a creature.
Collateral Damage deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: "I have no clan, but I still have purpose."
cards.name: Defiant Ogre
cards.text:
When Defiant Ogre enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on Defiant Ogre.
• Destroy target artifact.

cards.flavor:
"Dragons in the skies of Tarkir—for the first time, it feels like my home."
—Sarkhan Vol
cards.name: Dragonrage
cards.text: Add {R} to your mana pool for each attacking creature you control. Until end of turn, attacking creatures you control gain "{R}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."

cards.flavor: Anger can empower those who embrace it.
cards.name: Fierce Invocation
cards.text: Manifest the top card of your library, then put two +1/+1 counters on it. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

cards.name: Flamerush Rider
cards.text:
Whenever Flamerush Rider attacks, put a token onto the battlefield tapped and attacking that's a copy of another target attacking creature. Exile the token at end of combat.
Dash {2}{R}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

cards.name: Flamewake Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying, haste
Flamewake Phoenix attacks each turn if able.
Ferocious — At the beginning of combat on your turn, if you control a creature with power 4 or greater, you may pay {R}. If you do, return Flamewake Phoenix from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"Never tell goblins to ‘fire at will.'"
—Urut Barzeel, Mardu hordechief
cards.name: Friendly Fire
cards.text: Target creature's controller reveals a card at random from his or her hand. Friendly Fire deals damage to that creature and that player equal to the revealed card's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Goblin Heelcutter
cards.text:
Whenever Goblin Heelcutter attacks, target creature can't block this turn.
Dash {2}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

cards.flavor:
"The Mardu are like the gore swine. We are wild, hunt in packs, and rarely clean the blood from our blades."
—Vallash, Mardu warrior
cards.name: Gore Swine

cards.flavor:
"You were once Mardu, so your body and will are strong. Now we must train your mind."
—Houn, Jeskai elder
cards.name: Humble Defector
cards.text: {T}: Draw two cards. Target opponent gains control of Humble Defector. Activate this ability only during your turn.

cards.flavor: No clan is as adept at saying "go away" as the Temur.
cards.name: Hungering Yeti
cards.text: As long as you control a green or blue permanent, you may cast Hungering Yeti as though it had flash. (You may cast it any time you could cast an instant.)

cards.flavor: Dragonslayers learned to keep silent about their deeds after seeing the terrible vengeance wrought by Kolaghan and her brood.
cards.name: Lightning Shrieker
cards.text:
Flying, trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, Lightning Shrieker's owner shuffles it into his or her library.

cards.name: Mardu Runemark
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
Enchanted creature has first strike as long as you control a white or black permanent.

cards.flavor: The Mardu all enjoy war, but only the goblins make a game of it.
cards.name: Mardu Scout
cards.text: Dash {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

cards.name: Mob Rule
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Gain control of all creatures with power 4 or greater until end of turn. Untap those creatures. They gain haste until end of turn.
• Gain control of all creatures with power 3 or less until end of turn. Untap those creatures. They gain haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Outpost Siege
cards.text:
As Outpost Siege enters the battlefield, choose Khans or Dragons.
• Khans — At the beginning of your upkeep, exile the top card of your library. Until end of turn, you may play that card.
• Dragons — Whenever a creature you control leaves the battlefield, Outpost Siege deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"Take inspiration from your enemies, and make their strengths your own."
—Alesha, Who Smiles at Death
cards.name: Pyrotechnics
cards.text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Rageform
cards.text:
When Rageform enters the battlefield, it becomes an Aura with enchant creature. Manifest the top card of your library and attach Rageform to it. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
Enchanted creature has double strike. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

cards.name: Shaman of the Great Hunt
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Ferocious — {2}{G/U}{G/U}: Draw a card for each creature you control with power 4 or greater.

cards.flavor: Dragons of the Kolaghan brood are always on the move. They are the driving force behind the Mardu's nomadic way of life.
cards.name: Shockmaw Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Shockmaw Dragon deals combat damage to a player, it deals 1 damage to each creature that player controls.

cards.flavor: The efreet are drawn to the Kaisham Wanderers, a loosely organized Jeskai school where trickery is employed to challenge the status quo and upend the belief systems of others.
cards.name: Smoldering Efreet
cards.text: When Smoldering Efreet dies, it deals 2 damage to you.

cards.name: Temur Battle Rage
cards.text:
Target creature gains double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
Ferocious — That creature also gains trample until end of turn if you control a creature with power 4 or greater.

cards.name: Vaultbreaker
cards.text:
Whenever Vaultbreaker attacks, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
Dash {2}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

cards.flavor: Never mistake deception for cleverness.
cards.name: Wild Slash
cards.text:
Ferocious — If you control a creature with power 4 or greater, damage can't be prevented this turn.
Wild Slash deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: His beasts move the great siege towers of the Abzan across the endless sands.
cards.name: Abzan Beastmaster
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card if you control the creature with the greatest toughness or tied for the greatest toughness.

cards.flavor: "The Mardu rush headlong toward extinction. We ensure the longevity of our clan by protecting our territory, not rampaging through it."
cards.name: Abzan Kin-Guard
cards.text: Abzan Kin-Guard has lifelink as long as you control a white or black permanent.

cards.name: Ainok Guide
cards.text:
When Ainok Guide enters the battlefield, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on Ainok Guide.
• Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

cards.flavor: The Abzan merchants soon discovered why this route was clear of dragons.
cards.name: Ambush Krotiq
cards.text:
Trample
When Ambush Krotiq enters the battlefield, return another creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Arashin War Beast
cards.text: Whenever Arashin War Beast deals combat damage to one or more blocking creatures, manifest the top card of your library. (Put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

cards.flavor:
"We think of the naga as creeping cutthroats, slitherers in the swamps. But they are equally at home in the trees."
—Goton, Qal Sisma shaman
cards.name: Archers of Qarsi
cards.text:
Defender
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor: Krushoks clear debris from fertile fields, fallow fields, and battlefields.
cards.name: Battlefront Krushok
cards.text:
Battlefront Krushok can't be blocked by more than one creature.
Each creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it can't be blocked by more than one creature.

cards.flavor: The glittering scales in the Abzan vaults represent mighty deeds of the past and protection for generations to come.
cards.name: Cached Defenses
cards.text: Bolster 3. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put three +1/+1 counters on it.)

cards.flavor: After countless attacks on the Salt Road where it passes through the frozen tundra, the Abzan began to refer to the area as Atarka territory rather than Temur lands.
cards.name: Destructor Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
When Destructor Dragon dies, destroy target noncreature permanent.

cards.flavor: In a stunning act of diplomacy, Yasova Dragonclaw ceded a portion of Temur lands to the Sultai. Her clan protested until they saw she had given the Sultai the breeding grounds of the krushoks. They hadn't realized she had a sense of humor.
cards.name: Feral Krushok
Formless Nurturing
cards.text: Manifest the top card of your library, then put a +1/+1 counter on it. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

cards.flavor: Each bronze disk on its harness is an offering from a young Temur hunter, a sign of respect to the spirits of the wild.
cards.name: Frontier Mastodon
cards.text: Ferocious — Frontier Mastodon enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it if you control a creature with power 4 or greater.

cards.name: Frontier Siege
cards.text:
As Frontier Siege enters the battlefield, choose Khans or Dragons.
• Khans — At the beginning of each of your main phases, add {G}{G} to your mana pool.
• Dragons — Whenever a creature with flying enters the battlefield under your control, you may have it fight target creature you don't control.

cards.flavor: "I will be the ancestor my descendants call upon for aid. On that day I will take up my sword for my family once more."
cards.name: Fruit of the First Tree
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, you gain X life and draw X cards, where X is its toughness.

cards.flavor: Dragons scorn the weak, even among their own kind.
cards.name: Hunt the Weak
cards.text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. Then that creature fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.name: Map the Wastes
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library. Bolster 1. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor:
"Dragons are feared for their breath and their bite, but it is their wings that make them unconquerable. Bring them to earth, and they die like any other beast."
—Kassur, Sultai hunter
cards.name: Return to the Earth
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or creature with flying.

cards.flavor: A single battle affects countless others.
cards.name: Ruthless Instincts
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target nonattacking creature gains reach and deathtouch until end of turn. Untap it.
• Target attacking creature gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: A mastodon's path always leads to an oasis.
cards.name: Sandsteppe Mastodon
cards.text:
Reach
When Sandsteppe Mastodon enters the battlefield, bolster 5. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put five +1/+1 counters on it.)

cards.flavor: First, whispers of ancient days. Then, visions of things to come.
cards.name: Shamanic Revelation
cards.text:
Draw a card for each creature you control.
Ferocious — You gain 4 life for each creature you control with power 4 or greater.

cards.flavor:
"There is no secret buried so deep that we will never find it."
—Kurtar, Sultai necromancer
cards.name: Sudden Reclamation
cards.text: Put the top four cards of your library into your graveyard, then return a creature card and a land card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Temur Runemark
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
Enchanted creature has trample as long as you control a blue or red permanent.

cards.flavor: The Temur see themselves as a pack, their bonds more primal than the Abzan's.
cards.name: Temur Sabertooth
cards.text: {1}{G}: You may return another creature you control to its owner's hand. If you do, Temur Sabertooth gains indestructible until end of turn.

cards.name: Temur War Shaman
cards.text:
When Temur War Shaman enters the battlefield, manifest the top card of your library. (Put that card onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
Whenever a permanent you control is turned face up, if it's a creature, you may have it fight target creature you don't control.

cards.name: Warden of the First Tree
cards.text:
{1}{W/B}: Warden of the First Tree becomes a Human Warrior with base power and toughness 3/3.
{2}{W/B}{W/B}: If Warden of the First Tree is a Warrior, it becomes a Human Spirit Warrior with trample and lifelink.
{3}{W/B}{W/B}{W/B}: If Warden of the First Tree is a Spirit, put five +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.flavor: She speaks only in whispers but can be heard over the fiercest storm.
cards.name: Whisperer of the Wilds
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
Ferocious — {T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool. Activate this ability only if you control a creature with power 4 or greater.

cards.name: Whisperwood Elemental
cards.text:
At the beginning of your end step, manifest the top card of your library. (Put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)
Sacrifice Whisperwood Elemental: Until end of turn, face-up nontoken creatures you control gain "When this creature dies, manifest the top card of your library."

cards.flavor: A howl on the wind hides many dangers.
cards.name: Wildcall
cards.text: Manifest the top card of your library, then put X +1/+1 counters on it. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

cards.name: Winds of Qal Sisma
cards.text:
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
Ferocious — If you control a creature with power 4 or greater, instead prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by creatures your opponents control.

cards.name: Yasova Dragonclaw
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may pay {1}{U/R}{U/R}. If you do, gain control of target creature an opponent controls with power less than Yasova Dragonclaw's power until end of turn, untap that creature, and it gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Her hunger knows no limit. Left unchecked, she would feast on all of Tarkir."
—Yasova Dragonclaw
cards.name: Atarka, World Render
cards.text:
Flying, trample
Whenever a Dragon you control attacks, it gains double strike until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"The opponent who blocks the path, becomes the path."
—Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest
cards.name: Cunning Strike
cards.text:
Cunning Strike deals 2 damage to target creature and 2 damage to target player.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor:
"The bane of countless shattered weapons, each a failure to slay her."
—Daghatar the Adamant
cards.name: Dromoka, the Eternal
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a Dragon you control attacks, bolster 2. (Choose a creature with the least toughness among creatures you control and put two +1/+1 counters on it.)

cards.flavor: The energies of the Temur lands are readily unleashed upon intruders.
cards.name: Ethereal Ambush
cards.text: Manifest the top two cards of your library. (To manifest a card, put it onto the battlefield face down as a 2/2 creature. Turn it face up any time for its mana cost if it's a creature card.)

cards.flavor: The invader hoped he could survive the beast's jaws and emerge through its rotting skin.
cards.name: Grim Contest
cards.text: Choose target creature you control and target creature an opponent controls. Each of those creatures deals damage equal to its toughness to the other.

cards.flavor: The Shifting Wastes provide refuge to those who know where to look for it.
cards.name: Harsh Sustenance
cards.text: Harsh Sustenance deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life, where X is the number of creatures you control.

cards.name: Kolaghan, the Storm's Fury
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a Dragon you control attacks, creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
Dash {3}{B}{R} (You may cast this spell for its dash cost. If you do, it gains haste, and it's returned from the battlefield to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.)

cards.flavor:
"When I battled Ojutai, I realized my learning had only begun."
—Shu Yun, the Silent Tempest
cards.name: Ojutai, Soul of Winter
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
Whenever a Dragon you control attacks, tap target nonland permanent an opponent controls. That permanent doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.flavor:
"No machinations, no puppet strings, no plots. Just pure, sweeping death."
—Tasigur, the Golden Fang
cards.name: Silumgar, the Drifting Death
cards.text:
Flying, hexproof
Whenever a Dragon you control attacks, creatures defending player controls get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"No sun or fire can warm my blood quite like a war flare."
—Urut Barzeel, Mardu hordechief
cards.name: War Flare
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn. Untap those creatures.

cards.flavor: Dragonfire spawned many imitations. Some were more dramatic than others.
cards.name: Goblin Boom Keg
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Goblin Boom Keg.
When Goblin Boom Keg is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: The best swords are forged with dragonfire.
cards.name: Hero's Blade

cards.flavor:
"Their origins are shrouded in mystery. I believe they are the protectors of the lost secrets of our world."
—Jilaya, Temur whisperer
cards.name: Hewed Stone Retainers
cards.text: Cast Hewed Stone Retainers only if you've cast another spell this turn.

cards.flavor: The most skilled Jeskai artisans can craft imposing golems with such precision that they will last an eternity—the time believed necessary to master the Fires of the Jeskai Way.
cards.name: Pilgrim of the Fires
cards.text: First strike, trample

cards.name: Scroll of the Masters
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, put a lore counter on Scroll of the Masters.
{3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each lore counter on Scroll of the Masters.

cards.flavor: While trapping the Eldrazi on Zendikar, Ugin learned little from Sorin, but he gleaned the rudiments of lithomancy from Nahiri.
cards.name: Ugin's Construct
cards.text: When Ugin's Construct enters the battlefield, sacrifice a permanent that's one or more colors.

cards.name: Bloodfell Caves
cards.text:
Bloodfell Caves enters the battlefield tapped.
When Bloodfell Caves enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Blossoming Sands
cards.text:
Blossoming Sands enters the battlefield tapped.
When Blossoming Sands enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Crucible of the Spirit Dragon
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Put a storage counter on Crucible of the Spirit Dragon.
{T}, Remove X storage counters from Crucible of the Spirit Dragon: Add X mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast Dragon spells or activate abilities of Dragons.

cards.name: Dismal Backwater
cards.text:
Dismal Backwater enters the battlefield tapped.
When Dismal Backwater enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Jungle Hollow
cards.text:
Jungle Hollow enters the battlefield tapped.
When Jungle Hollow enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Rugged Highlands
cards.text:
Rugged Highlands enters the battlefield tapped.
When Rugged Highlands enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Scoured Barrens
cards.text:
Scoured Barrens enters the battlefield tapped.
When Scoured Barrens enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Swiftwater Cliffs
cards.text:
Swiftwater Cliffs enters the battlefield tapped.
When Swiftwater Cliffs enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Thornwood Falls
cards.text:
Thornwood Falls enters the battlefield tapped.
When Thornwood Falls enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Tranquil Cove
cards.text:
Tranquil Cove enters the battlefield tapped.
When Tranquil Cove enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Wind-Scarred Crag
cards.text:
Wind-Scarred Crag enters the battlefield tapped.
When Wind-Scarred Crag enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.
